monster.name: Alraune
monster.resist: Psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks.

trait.name: Alluring Scent
trait.text: Creatures that enter or start their turn within 30 ft. of the alraune must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the alraune for 1 minute. A creature charmed in this way only can move as close as it can to the alraune. A creature charmed by the alraune can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Creatures that have succeeded on this saving throw are immune to the alraune's alluring scent for 24 hours.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The Alraune's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells with no material components.
• At will: druidcraft, minor illusion, charm person. • 3/Day each: entangle, suggestion, phantasmal force • 1/Day each: plant growth, dominate person

trait.name: Plant camouflage
trait.text: The alraune has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in areas of dense foliage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The alraune attacks twice with constrict.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning and an additional 4 (1d6) piercing damage. Large or smaller creatures must make a DC 16 Str (Athletics) check when they are hit or be restrained. They may repeat this save as an action on their turn.
action.attack: Bludgeoning And An Additional 4 (1d6) Piercing Damage|+6|1d6+3

action.name: Vampiric Vines
action.text: The Alraune causes thorny vines to erupt from the ground in a 20foot radius centered on itself. Each creature of its choice in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) necrotic damage on a failed saave, or half as much on a success. The alraune regains hit points equal to half the total damage dealt.

monster.spells: Druidcraft, Minor Illusion, Charm Person, Entangle, Suggestion, Phantasmal Force, Plant Growth, Dominate Person
monster.description:
Alraune's are plant-fey hybrids born from cursed soil, taking the form of alluring humanoid flowers that ensnare the hearts and minds of the living. They lure intruders with intoxicating pheromones and then drain vitality to feed their ever-hungry roots.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 14 (Third Party)

monster.name: Aureolin Musk Creeper

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, this creature is indistinguishable from a benign plant.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The creeper regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes fire, necrotic, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the creeper's next turn. The creeper dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and cannot regenerate.

action.name: Vines
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid or beast that drops to 0 hit points as a result of this damage, it is implanted with an aureolin musk creeper bulb. Creatures implanted with a bulb are poisoned until the bulb is removed. The bulb is destroyed by a remove curse or restoration spell. Dead bulb-implanted creatures revive after 24 hours as aureolin musk creepers.

action.name: Aureolin Musk
action.text: The creeper's flowers release an irrating musk that targets all humanoids and beasts within 30 ft. of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become enraged for 1 minute. An enraged creature must spend its turn moving to be adjacent to the nearest other humanoid or beast, dashing if necessary, and then attacking with a mele attack. A creature enraged by the creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Creatures that are immune to being charmed cannot be affected by the musk.,

monster.description:
A dangerous, vine-like plant that exudes a sweet, intoxicating musk to lure living creatures close. Once ensnared, it implants spores that slowly turn victims into mindless thralls, spreading its tending the monstrous flora.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 16 (Third Party)

monster.name: Aureolin Musk Zombie

trait.name: Enraged Zombie Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the damage taken, unless the damage is fire or is a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Aureolin Musk Death Cloud
trait.text: When the zombie dies, its flowers release an irritating musk that targets all humanoids and beasts within 30 ft. of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or become enraged for 1 minute. An enraged creature must spend its turns moving to be adjacent to the nearest other humanoid or beast and attacking. An enraged creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Creatures that are immune to being charmed cannot be affected by the musk.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 9 (1d8+4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The juvenile form of the aureolin musk creeper. A corpse covered in sprawling, sickly vines and covered in yellow blossoms, exuding a reeking pollen. The creatures stumble forward seeking to spread the yellow musk pollen far and wide.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 17 (Third Party)

monster.name: Flowering Shambling Mound

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, this creature is indistinguishable from a benign plant.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the flowering shambling mound is hit with lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage taken.

trait.name: Irritating Pollen
trait.text: When damaged by an attack, creatures within 10 ft. of the flowering shambling mound must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for one round.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The flowering shambling mound makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cloud of Pollen
action.text: Creatures within 30 ft. of the flowering shamblin mound must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become stunned for one round and take 14 (4d6) poison damage.

monster.description:
Once a shambling mound has existed for a few months, new seedlings begin to grow that reinforce the electrified dead vegetation. This new life makes the shambling mound more aggressive, especially as the plants begin to flower.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 18 (Third Party)

monster.name: Mandrake

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, this creature is indistinguishable from a benign plant.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Scream
action.text: All creatures that are not plants in a 15 ft. cone must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 11 (3d6) thunder damage and become stunned for 1 turn on a failed saving throw, taking half damage on a success.

monster.description:
Mandrakes are small, root-like plant creatures that resemble ugly and wrinkled human infants with leafy green shoots sprouting from their heads. Though slow and harmless on their own, they emit a piercing screech when disturbed, startling predators and alerting nearby allies. Herbalists prize them for their magical properties, but harvesting one without proper care can trigger its shriek, drawing unwanted attention.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 19 (Third Party)

monster.name: Nepenthes Mantrap

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, this creature is indistinguishable from a benign plant.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nepenthese mantrap makes two vine lash attacks.

action.name: Vine Lash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and the mantrap can't use that vine on another target.

action.name: Engulf
action.text: The nepenthese mantrap attempts to swallow a Medium or smaller creature it has grappled. The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be pulled inside the mantrap's flower. While engulfed, the creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks, and other effects outside the Mantrap, and takes 5 (2d4) acid damage at the start of each of the mantrap's turns. A creature can attempt to escape by succeeding on a DC 13 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check as an action.

monster.description:
The majority of the size of this carnivorous pitcher plant is the large acid-filled pitcher. With a sweet aroma and a hunger for prey this plant makes a great addition to any garden with too many pests.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 20 (Third Party)

monster.name: Primeval Wood Woad

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The primeval wood woad's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The wood woad can innately cast spells without material components.
• Cantrips (at will): Druid Craft, Thorn Whip • 1st level (3 slots): Entangle, Pass without Trace

trait.name: Magic Club
trait.text: In the primeval wood woad's hand, its club is magical and deals 4 (2d4) extra damage included in its attacks.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
trait.text: The primeval wood woad has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in areas of dense foliage.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The primeval wood woad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it is in contact with the ground. If it takes fire, necrotic, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the primeval wood woad's next turn. The primeval wood woad r dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and cannot regenerate.

trait.name: Tree Stride
trait.text: Once on its turn, the primeval wood woad can use 10 ft. of its movement to step magically into one living tree within reach and emerge from a second living tree within 50 ft. of the first tree appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The primeval wood woad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Plants
trait.text: The primeval wood woad can communicate with plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The primeval wood woad makes two attacks with its club.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (3d4+3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: Druid Craft, Thorn Whip, Entangle, Pass without Trace
monster.description:
An ancient and gnarled version of a wood woad, these plants take centuries to reach full maturity. They cannot grow in urban environments and must have a minimum of one mile of dense forest per wood woad.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 22 (Third Party)

monster.name: Slithering Assassin Vine

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, this creature is indistinguishable from a benign plant.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
trait.text: While grappling with a creature, the assassin vine takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and the grappled creature takes the other half.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is large or smaller, it and the assassin vine become grappled. While grappled, the assassin vine can make this attack only against its grappled target and has advantage on the attack roll. The assassin vine can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the assassin vine by succeeding on a DC 16 Str (Athletics) check. At the end of each of the grappled creature's turns they must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or begin to suffocate.

action.name: Bulb
action.text: Bulb can only be used on a creature the assassin vine is grappling. Target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take 16 (3d8+4) slashing damage and a small bulb is injected under their skin. During the creature's next long rest the bulb grows into another slithering assassin vine that starts attached to the target. The new assassin vine lacks this ability for one month. The bulb can be removed with a DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check.

monster.description:
This mobile constricting vine suffocates prey by wrapping around the target's head and neck. The adult slithering assassin uses friction to cut open skin, placing a bulb beneath the surface.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 24 (Third Party)

monster.name: Snapping Bloom

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, this creature is indistinguishable from a benign plant.

trait.name: Blood Meal
trait.text: This creature gets advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are at or below half health.

trait.name: Powerful Jaws
trait.text: This creature ignores resistance to piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The snapping bloom makes a bite attack and then a reel attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 18 Strenth (Athletics) check or be restrained. While it has a creature restrained, the snapping bloom cannot bite another target.

action.name: Reel
action.text: A target creature the snapping bloom has grappled is pulled 10 ft. towards it and takes 14 (2d8+5) piercing damage. If the target ends its movement adjacent to the snapping bloom, it may immediately make a chomp attack.

action.name: Chomp
action.text: The snapping bloom can only perform a Chomp action upon an adjacent medium or smaller creature that is has restrained. Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 33 (8d6 + 5) piercing damage. On a successful hit, the target is no longer restrained.

monster.description:
A large plant with a prominent bulb-shaped flower resting on a long flexible stalk. These perpetually hungry plants kill their prey with rows of hard teeth like petals at the center of their flower.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 25 (Third Party)

monster.name: Tropical Thorny

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
trait.text: The tropical thorny has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in areas of dense foliage.

trait.name: Solar Enhancements
trait.text: When in direct sunlight, the thorny has advantage on attack rolls.

trait.name: Solar Regeneration
trait.text: While in direct sunlight, the thorny heals 4 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the thorny's next turn. The thorny only dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Vines
trait.text: The thorny sticks to anything that touches it. A huge or smaller creature that the thorny touches is grappled. While grappled, the creature takes 1d4 piercing damage at the beginning of each of their turns. To escape, the grappled creature must make a DC 12 Strength saving throw at the beginning of its turn.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Thorn Spray
action.text: The thorny spews thorns in a 15 ft. cone. All creatures in the cone must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 5 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4+2) piercing damage. The target must make a DC 12 Strength saving throw or they will be grappled by the vines.

monster.description:
A loyal floral companion if raised from a seedling, this vine-covered quadruped is aggressive towards strangers. If well-taken-care-of, offprint of the tropical thorny are known to recognize those close to their progenitors without ever meeting them.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 26 (Third Party)

monster.name: Tropical Vegepygmy

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
trait.text: The tropical vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in areas of dense foliage.

trait.name: Hardened
trait.text: The tropical vegepygmy takes no falling damage.

trait.name: Solar Enhancement
trait.text: While in direct sunlight, the vegepygmy gets advantage on attack rolls. Additionally, damage from the plummet action deals an additional 1d6 radiant damage and ignores bludgeoning resistance.

trait.name: Solar Regeneration
trait.text: While in direct sunlight, the vegepygmy heals 4 hit points at the start of its turn. if it takes cold, fire or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. hit: 5 (1d4+2) slashing damage.

action.name: Plummet
action.text: The vegepygmy targets a creature at least 10 feet directly below it and drops down. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet fallen (maximum 3d6). If in direct sunlight, the attack deals an additional 1d6 radiant damage and ignores bludgeoning resistance.

monster.description:
These small intelligent creatures are covered in a hard coconut-like shell. Their aggression towards outsiders makes them difficult for gardeners to grow.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Fantastic Flora p. 28 (Third Party)
